meanings.definition: A type of large, heavy musket or light cannon used in the 19th century.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers carried a jingal into battle.
meanings.sent2: The jingal was a powerful weapon on the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The jingal seemed to have a mind of its own, booming loudly with each shot.
meanings.sent4: The jingal's roar echoed through the valley, striking fear into the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The metallic gleam of the jingal under the sun made it a formidable sight.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh, or discordant noise.
meanings.sent1: The jingal of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent2: The jingal of thunder rumbled in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The jingal of the car horn startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent4: The jingal of the fire alarm pierced through the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The jingal of the wind howling outside made it hard to sleep.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh, or discordant noise.
meanings.sent1: The drums jingaled loudly during the festival.
meanings.sent2: She jingaled on the piano, creating a cacophony of sound.
meanings.sent3: The cat jingaled in protest when the bathwater touched its fur.
meanings.sent4: The old door jingaled as it swung back and forth in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The children jingaled with laughter as they played in the park.
